name: 張裕煦
objective: This course will be concerned with the theory and the applications of instrumental methods for the qualitative and quantitative analysis of chemical substances including solid materials. The technical backgrounds and design of UV-Vis, ICP-AES, AA, FT-IR, XPS/Auger electron spectroscopy, SEM/AFM and TGA/DTA/DSC will be introduced in a semester.
schedule:
1.     Chap. 1  Introduction
2-3   Chap. 6  An introduction to spectrometric methods
3-4   Chap. 8  An introduction to optical atomic spectrometry
5     exam 1
6-7   Chap. 9  Atomic absorption and atomic fluorescence spectrometry 
8-9   Chap. 10 Atomic emission spectrometry
10-11  Chap. 14 Applications of UV/Vis absorption spectrometry
12    exam 2
13-14 Chap. 16 An introduction to infrared spectrometry
15     Chap. 17 Applications of infrared spectrometry
16     Chap. 21 Surface characterization by spectroscopy & microscopy
17     Chap. 31 Thermal methods
18     Final exam
scorePolicy:
The final grade will be determined by:
33.3 % midterm 1 + 33.3 % midterm 2 +
33.3 % final exam + attendance
materials: Principles of Instrumental Analysis –7th edition; Skoog, Holler, Crouch
remarks: English as a Medium of Instruction If distance teaching is implemented, Microsoft Teams software will be used for online teaching, and Zuvio will conduct online calling. Contact information: yhchang@ntut.edu.tw
